ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] only few thread active after a long time run
ygData.msgSnippet: I see there are only 6 host queues in existence. There will never be more active threads than host queues, and usually much fewer threads, as some queues will

I see there are only 6 host queues in existence. There will never be more
active threads than host queues, and usually much fewer threads, as some
queues will be ineligible to supply URIs (for example during politeness
pauses).

However, your thread report is suspicious. Is the crawl making any progress?
Your crawl may have hit a fatal error. Is there anything in heritrix_out.log?
Code in CVS HEAD has had disk-queueing bugs recently that can corrupt (and
freeze) a Frontier, until a fix Friday.

- Gordon @ IA

> ======== 2004-07-30 17:43:51 ����������д���� ========
>  
> 
>     The most probable cause is that most sites within the scope have
>     been exhausted leaving only a handful of sites that are insufficient
>     - given politeness rules - to fully utilize availible threads.
> 
>     That��s just a guess of course. When asking questions like this it
>     really helps to include the number of documents waiting for download
>     and the number of queues reported by the Frontier report (as that is
>     the best indicator of how many hosts are being processed at the moment).
> 
>      
> 
>     - Kris
>
